ISSUE.TITLE: [Bug]: DNS doesn't work for containers
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description Connecting from one container to another via names. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Create network: ``` podman network create default ``` 2. Create one container: ``` podman run -it --rm --network default -p 80:80 --name nginx nginx ``` 3. Create another container: ``` podman run -it --rm --network default fedora:37 bash ``` 4. Try to connect from second container: ``` curl nginx ``` ### Describe the results you received ```[root@0782f7f5eae7 /]# curl nginx curl: (6) Could not resolve host: nginx ``` ### Describe the results you expected Resolve of DNS name and default nginx page. ### podman info output ```shell host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.28.0 cgroupControllers: - BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #17086 from edsantiago/is_14653_fixed Remove workarounds for 14653 (checkpoint test failures)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: network create: do not allow `default` as name `default` is already used as network mode, i.e. podman run --network default will choose the default mode not a network named `default`. We already block names from other network modes, default was forgotten. Fixes #17169 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
